qas.question: What does the decline in value of the dollar correspond to?
The rise in level of prices in an economy is referred to as what?
Who publishes the Consumer Price Index?

answers.text: average price of consumer goods and services in the United States

qas.question: What does the decline in value of the average price correspond to?
What is the rise in level of living expenses in an economy referred to?

plausible_answers.text: The United States Consumer Price Index

qas.question: What is published by the CPI?
Who publishes the prices of goods and services?

plausible_answers.text: average price of consumer goods and services in the United States

qas.question: What does the Bureau of Labor Statistics estimate?

context: The decline in the value of the U.S. dollar corresponds to <a0_0><a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>price inflation<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, which is a rise in the general level of prices of goods and services in an economy over a period of time. A <a2_0>consumer price index<a2_0/> (CPI) is a measure estimating the average price of consumer goods and services purchased by households. <b7_0>The United States Consumer Price Index<b7_0/>, published by the <a3_0><b8_0>Bureau of Labor Statistics<b8_0/><a3_0/>, is a measure estimating the <a4_0><b9_0>average price of consumer goods and services in the United States<b9_0/><a4_0/>. It reflects inflation as experienced by consumers in their day-to-day living expenses. A graph showing the U.S. CPI relative to 1982–1984 and the annual year-over-year change in CPI is shown at right.
